intro: Lesquerella pruinosa, commonly known as the pruinose lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces spherical, hairy seed pods that contain numerous small, black seeds. Lesquerella pruinosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
